result.execSummary:
The defendant Samuel J. Thom was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with victim.
Shall write a letter of apology to the victim.
Shall pay $600 to victim or return tractor bucket to victim. AMENDED 8/21/15 - SHALL PAY $600 TO VICTIM AS PREVIOUSLY ORDERED THROUGH THE DODGE COUNTY CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE

timeConds.notes:
Shall complete 20 hours of community service. 
**If tractor bucket is returned to victim, community service requirement is eliminated.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Defendant, Samuel J. Thom in court, Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State heard; parties have stipulated to $600 in restitiution; Court orders same and payments to be made to the Clerk of Courts office;
Probation Intake Order
Restitution hearing at 08-21-2015 10:00 am

Defendant, Samuel J. Thom in court, Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court heard from State and Defendant and sentenced him as follows:
S/W, probation for one year with terms: Restitution of $600 or return of the tractor bucket.  Fine of $200 plus costs.  Letter of apology to the victim-agent approved, and twenty hours of community service.  Rest. Hearing scheduled-defendant stated he's returned the bucket.  If proof that the bucket was returned is provided, community service is eliminated. No contact or communication with victim.
Sentencing hearing on July 6, 2015 at 09:00 am.

9:31 - Defendant, Samuel J. Thom in court, Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions def and reviews chgs and pens.  Court accepts waiver of attorney.  State has complied with victim rights notification.  NC plea entered in count 1.  Court accepts plea and finds def guilty.  Court sets sentencing out to allow def time to pay restitution.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 09:00 am.

8:16 - Defendant, Samuel J. Thom appeared by phone means, Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions def on phone appearance and legal representation.  Def indicates had work conflict and wants to proceed without an attorney.  Court adjourns until today at 9:30 for a plea hearing.  Defendant advised to complete plea form and waiver of right to an attorney.
Continuance
for continuance
Continuance
Restitution Summary
Plea hearing on April 29, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Defendant, Samuel J. Thom in court, James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Not eligible for SPD services.  Court does not find defendant indigent and does not appoint an attorney.
SPD Determination - Not Eligible
Review hearing on April 1, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant, Samuel J. Thom in court, Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Def. heard - going to SPD after this hearing; RH set next Wed. 4/1/15 at 8:15 in Br. 4; JT remains; bond cont.
Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with TLH.

9:35 - Defendant, Samuel J. Thom in court, Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges and penalties. Court finds probable cause. RD & JT set. Court sets $500 PA bond with conditions:   Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.   Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with TLH.  Return date scheduled for March 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
